instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message:
Hi guys, 
The board stuck in an SMC_RESET loop, keeps on restarting every 2 seconds. Power pads don't work (shutting it down I mean). Had water damage over the U5750, U7000 area. Both were replaced.
Concerning voltage, everything seems to be right and present. A hint anyone?
Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message: SMC_RESET going high and low? Green light?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message: SMC_RESET_L stay at 3.0V , SMC chip was also replaced, problem persists. Green light is present

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message:
Ppbus_g3h=10.6v , pp3v3_s5=3.3v ,
ppvcore_s0_cpu=1.1v , ppvcore_s0_axg=0v , pp1v05_s3_cpu_vccdq=1.5v , pp1v05_s0_cpu_vccpqe=1.05v , pp1v05_s0_cpu=0.8v

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message:
I assume this was measured on battery else PPBUS is way too low.
PP1V05 is of course not correct at 0.8V but makes no sense as pp1v05_s0_cpu_vccpqe is directly connected to it......

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message:
PPBUS was measured with the charger connected, no battery attached. 
My bad, I meant: 
ppvcore_s0_cpu=1.1v , ppvcore_s0_axg=0v , pp1v05_s3_cpu_vccdq=1.5v , pp1v05_s0_cpu_vccpqe=1.05v ,PPVCCSA_S0_CPU=0.8V

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message: 10.6 on PPBUS makes no sense. If Vcore is stable at 1.1V the fan should be running normal.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message: PPBUS is not stable. It changes from 3.3V to 10.7V (during this loopy process)

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message: Measure resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 from U7000 also check R7005 value........

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message: I guess you meant those 2 current sensing circuits, resistors R7020 and R7050 - those are measured at 0 ohm, as they should I think. R7005 is measured at 20 ohm so those look to be alright

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message: Read my request again and answer....

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message: The resistance between pins 17 and 18 is 0 ohm, also between 27 and 28. R7005 is 20 ohm. Thank you for your replies

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message: between 17 and 18 should be 2.2ish. Check what is going on there.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message:
Thank you. One line from the two was cut and fixed. Now PPBUS measured at 12.7V, the device finally runs.
It is getting into sleep mode randomly and ASD shows only one error with VP0R sensor, which is measured too low

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message: Probably bad battery indicator or corrosion in the connector pulling SMC_LID low. VP0R is Q5300, so probably corrosion around there.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 stuck in a loop
threads.message: It was the battery indicator flex cable. Now everything is smooth as it should. Appreciate the help guys!
